page.title: 03COASTAL FOOTPATH AT ST.AGNES
page.content: THE CORNISH COASTAL FOOTPATH RUNS ALONG THE CLIFF TOPS FROM ST.AGNES TO PERRANPORTH.IT IS STEEP IN PLACES AND VERY STONEY AND WINDY.FROM THE FOOTPATH YOU GET AN EXCELLANT VIEW AND ON A GOOD DAY YOU CAN SEE UP THE COAST TO NEWQUAY AND TREVOZE HEAD.JUST OFF SHORE ARE TWO ROCKS CALLED MAN AND HIS MAN,SOMETIMES CALLED BAWDEN ROCKS. AROUND THE FOOTPATH IS HEATHER AND GORSE AND IN SOME PARTS THE PATH IS ALMOST OVERGROWN.NEAR TREVELLAS PORTH THE PATH IS VERY ROUGH AND COVERED WITH BRAMBLES. THE FOOTPATH PASSES CLOSE AROUND{HANOVER COVE}SO NAMED WHEN A SAILING SHIP WAS WRECKED THERE DURING A STORM.THE ROCKS ARE RICH IN COLOUR AND INLAND,SHEEP AND COWS CAN BE SEEN GRAZING.THE VIEWS ARE BREATHTAKING BUT{BEWARE!}THE CLIFFS ARE HIGH AND DON'T FORGET TO COVER UP WELL ON A WINDY DAY.
